intro: Chamaesyce niqueroana, commonly known as the Niqueroan sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or dry habitats. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
